metadata.ttm:title: Re-representation of Business Size
metadata.ttm:desc: Federal agencies often set aside Contracts for small businesses whose revenue falls under a specific threshold. As part of the Contract Offer process, your Company will have been required to certify that it is or is not a small business. The Re-Representation of Business Size Modification allows you to inform GSA if your Company outgrows its small business designation, meaning it exceeds the revenue threshold that allows it to be categorized as a small business. Or, in the contrary instance, you can inform GSA if your Company size has decreased, meaning that it will qualify as a small business.

div.p: Federal agencies often set aside contracts for small
businesses with revenues under a specified
threshold.
As part of the contract offer process, your
company was required to certify that it was or was
not a small business.
The Re-Representation of Business Size modification
allows you to inform GSA if your company outgrows
its small business designation, meaning it
exceeds the revenue threshold that allows it
to be categorized as a small business; OR, if
your company size decreases and it now
qualifies as a small business.
Within the text box, provide the CO with the
reason you are re-representing your
company's business size.
This information can be relatively high-level as
you are going to need to provide supporting
documentation in the Upload Documents section.
When you are finished click the "Save and
Continue" button.
